actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to provide that taxpayers shall not be required to reduce the amount of casualty loss deductions by the amount of reimbursement anticipated from the cancellation of certain Federal loans made in the case of certain disasters.

summary.text: Provides, under the Internal Revenue Code, that the taxpayer shall not be required to reduce the amount of reimbursement anticipated from the cancellation of Federal loans made in the case of disasters under the Small Business Act or the Consolidated Farmers Home Administration Act. (Amends 26 U.S.C. 165)

titles.title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to provide that taxpayers shall not be required to reduce the amount of casualty loss deductions by the amount of reimbursement anticipated from the cancellation of certain Federal loans made in the case of certain disasters.
